page.title: 20LOCAL SETTLEMENTS contd.
page.content: This increased affluence and mobility has also meant the end of many village shops and services as the car owners are able to shop weekly or even monthly at the supermarkets in Bishops Stortford. Nevertheless a few shops survive either because they are specialised like the MG carparts shop in Little Hadham or because they are multi-purpose such as the Post Office - stores at Farnham. There are also a number of public houses as the motor car allows people to travel long distances for recreation. Drink driving laws however may affect this pattern in the future. Small primary schools serve the local families such as the school at Little Hadham. The decline in local shops has hit the old and poor who do not have cars. The bus service has also declined in recent years and this has led to isolation.
